intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. amoenicolor, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble clusters of small flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with a distinctive central disc surrounded by ray florets, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, pastures, and along roadsides.
